name: Hotel Palomar San Francisco - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: Great !!!! A+++++++++
Perfect Location in San Fran
reviews.text: Excellent location, very nice rooms friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not be better, A++++++++++
reviews.title: Great Find - Thanks Trip Advisor!!!

likes.disliked: — The fee for valet parking, but you are in the city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our familiy of six stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Palomar in connecting rooms. The rooms were above average and service was superior, especially the bell desk staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff!

likes.liked: — Great staff, beautiful room, convenient location

reviews.text: The bar was nice for a drink. We would recommend eating breakfast elsewhere as the service was slow and food expensive. We ate at Lori's Diner after the first day and found the service and expense more in line.
reviews.title: Best Bathtub in the world!

reviews.text: BF and I stayed here July 4-6, taking advantage of the Hot Dates, Great Rates on their website. Room was $139 a night and a good value for that price. Location was fantastic, right by Market Street, about a twenty minute walk to the Embarcadero, Giants stadium, ten minutes tops to Union Square. Decor was modern (no flowers), room was small but furniture was solid and bed was heavenly. No view, but also no noise. The turndown service was a nice touch - they even selected music for us. Clean and stylish. I like that they give you the option of replacing your towels and linens in an effort to conserve energy and water. Front desk was fantastic, doormen were super-friendly.
reviews.title: Great if you get a hot rate
Absolutely Wonderful!!!!
reviews.text: Just came back from an awesome weekend in San Francisco and stayed at the Hotel Palomar. I have never been more impressed with a hotel and their staff as I presently am with the Hotel Palomar. It is a beautiful and contemporary boutique hotel located almost 2 blocks from Union Square, close enough to public transportation and major attractions. The rooms are generously proportioned with fantastic accents and the beds are soo warm and comfortable. Especially with the down comforters....The staff went out of their way to help celebrate my partners birthday and even left a gift in our room. Whenever we return to San Francisco, we will not stay anywhere but the Hotel Palomar.

reviews.title: Good Hotel but nothing to get excited about
reviews.text: This is a good solid boutique hotel where you will have a comfortable stay. There is no wow factor - so if you are looking for spectacular views or grand lobbies, this is not the place.

The location is good - about a block from Union Square. The rooms are decent sized - we had a executive king on the 6th floor. At first they gave us a similar room on the seventh flr which was facing a wall - terrible view. But upon request, they gave us the one on the 6th flr with a view of market street - much better.
reviews.title: A total class-act; nicest place I've stayed

reviews.text: The bed, pillows, linens are all very high quality and comfortable. Service was for Room Service (good food!), Valet parking and Housekeeping.
reviews.title: Perfect boutique hotel

reviews.text: I have just come back from the above hotel, stayed with my son. Absolutely perfect, the staff were friendly and ever so helpful, the room was spacious, and very clean. The bed was comfortable, and we had 24 hours access to the Gym. The location of the hotel was brilliant! was very convenient as all the shops i.e. Nordstorm, Bloomingdales, Macys, Westfields, Gap, Old Navy are literally around the the corner. The transport is brilliant and also close by were the Trams. This hotel ticks the box for business, couples, family, friends and solo!!
reviews.title: Hotel Palomar San Francisco

reviews.text: I will definately be visiting again.
reviews.title: Ideal location, luxury property at reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent - in the heart of great shopping and restaurants, a few steps away from the Powell BART station. Lots of action during the day and early evevning on Market Street, but the hotel has somehow managed to block the sound from the street. Our room was surprisingly quiet which made for great night's of rest and sleep. The room was clean, and provided that Kimpton look - everywhere you looked little touches from the Fortune Cookie, the posh bath robes, and product line in the bathroom. I've stated at several five-star properties in San Francisco and the Hotel Palomar was the best deal with five star amenities. The meals in the restaurant were excellent - eggs benedict for breakfast and by far one of the tastiest I've had in a long time. The evening wine tasting and well-trained staff just added to the overall experience. Big thanks to Guest Services Manager Josh Frizzell for going above and beyond to welcome us when we arrived, and for seeing to it that a special amenity was hand-delivered to our room (by him!).
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.text: Spent a pleasant night at the Palomar in SF in early February. As usual, the Kimpton room was spotless and comfortable. Unfortunately, our room overlooked the inside court so we had to keep our windows covered most of the time. The wine hour was very good as well - although I found the 5th floor lounge somewhat lacking (it was dark and the seating was not as comfortable as other Kimpton's we've been to). The front desk attendants were very nice and helpful - and of course - there was always someone there to open the main floor door for you. The hotel is located in an excellent spot in the city. Two blocks to Union Square and half a block to the Bart. We would stay here again!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but meeting rooms and guest rooms do not mix!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many positives about this hotel, so I will start with those.
reviews.title: best stay for the price in sf!
nice and different
reviews.text: The Palomar is not what we expected. It is very modern and has an understated European luxury feel to it. While the room was immaculate, it seemed small and the bathroom door gave little privacy. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room on the 4th floor had an outstanding view! The restaraunt is hidden and there really is no lobby to speak of, so waiting for friends to arrive was not convienent. On departure they offered a Lincoln Town car to take us to the Airport for the same price as a Taxi. A nice touch to end our vacation. All in all, not a bad place to stay. But I felt out of place as a tourist. It seems more like a high end Hotel for the Business traveller. The location was very conveinent to the cable cars, street cars and subway.

reviews.title: Nice Rooms
reviews.text: DavidinHartford.

reviews.title: nice hotel
reviews.text: If you are looking for large rooms in SF, then Palomar may be a great value. While it is expensive during the week, they have great weekend rates and the rooms are huge in comparison. We had a suite and our friends had a standard room, and we were both very happy with the accomodations. We found the staff very helpful. The only knock I would have is that the restaurant is overpriced. We would definitely stay again. Can't beat the location if you want be near Union Square.

reviews.title: We loved it! Great location, great staff, great decor. Shower pressure could be better.
reviews.text: we stayed in the palomar in november 2004 for a week. we visit the usa on a fairly regular basis and never book a hotel without checking the reviews on tripadvisor. having read the reviews we decided to book our stay.we were not dissapointed, the rooms are very nice, the bed was the best we have ever slept in, the staff were pleasant and helpful, and the hotel is centrally located, union square being only a few minutes walk away. we never dined in the restaurant but did have breakfast one morning, the food was great if a little pricey, we would definitely stay there again. well worth its four stars.

It's true, it is a hassle to have to go downstairs to grab coffee. We were pretty surprised by this too, but we really didn't mind much. It was actually kind of nice to get out and stretch our legs in the morning.
reviews.title: LOVED the Palomar!!

reviews.text: I highly recommend the Hotel Palomar to business and tourist guests. The people at the Palomar are simply the nicest and most responsive hotel staff I've met in some time. At 6am I walked into our meeting room that felt like a beautiful and comfortable room in a nice house. Ung Ly was already there to greet me . He is the very personable and knowledgeable Conference Services Manager and helped us throughout the day. For a reasonable fee we were able to move our lunch set up to the 5th Floor Restaurant since they are closed for lunch. This gave us a wonderful and private room filled with sunlight in which to dine. After a long work day and a dinner at a nearby Peruvian Restaurant I came back to the hotel needing to send an urgent fax. Doma Chonzom was waiting at the front desk ready to greet me with a beautiful smile. She helped ensure my document was printed and then faxed in time. Doma's pleasant speaking voice and friendly demeanor took the edge off my haste and made our interaction a delightful way to end the evening! The food here is delicious and every person I met from Doorman, to Manager, to Service Staff all the way to the end of the evening with Doma was genuine, and calming. What a nice way to accomplish a lot of good work! I recommend anyone wanting to hold a business meeting in S.F. to come to the Hotel Palomar to enjoy the experience! Tourist welcome too! :-)
reviews.title: Leadership Team Offsite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel, very central near Union Sq. Close to the Sidecars and Trams. Great for shopping. Cheerful staff. Didn't try the 5th floor Bar but heard good reports. Room was clean and spacious and quiet for a city centre hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, perfect for a few days in San Fran

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights on a West Coast USA trip with my friend. Before we even arrived at the hotel I emailed with a couple of queries regarding transportation and bed types in the room. We received a very prompt and friendly response from Josh, who also happened to be in reception when we arrived after nearly 18 hours of transatlantic and transcontinental flying. Josh ensured we got a room with two beds, got us some wine as we had missed wine hour and made sure we were quickly checked into our room.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location

reviews.text: The location was absolutely fantastic. We had Alcatraz tickets for first thing in the morning, so armed with complimentary hot chocolate and green tea, following a complimentary breakfast we headed out across the street to get the trolley which dropped us almost opposite where we needed to be at the Pier. We then had hop on hop off tickets which allowed us to get off at Union Square which was a couple of blocks away from the hotel and ten minutes walk tops. We headed that way for dinner after the wine reception (2 glasses of complimentary white wine) and walked back without issue.
reviews.title: Excellent and the best part is.....

reviews.text: Had a hilarious experience on the top of a hop on hop off bus going across the Golden Gate Bridge while it was hailing and arrived back at the hotel all stressed out, however the staff couldn't have been more helpful pointing us in the right direction for our BART trip to the airport.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the best location

reviews.text: We found this hotel by chance via Expedia and booked it give the positive reviews on TA. This hotel is a great “boutique” style property situated right in the heart of San Fran.
reviews.title: A Gem in San Fran!
Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: All the places we wanted to see were easily accessible from this hotel either by walking or by tram/train/streetcar/bus all of which are within a block of this hotel. Outside the hotel you will find pan handlers and homeless people however, this is to be expected anywhere in San Fran (you can also expect this outside the Four Season’s which is only a block away).
The property is very clean and stylish without being too over the top. The room was on the smaller side but very clean and comfortable. The bed was great along with the linens and towels.
reviews.title: Hotle Palomar exceeded our expectations!
Thumbs Up For The Hotel Palomar
reviews.text: We rented a car and took a day trip to Napa which is highly recommended. The wineries were great and the food was amazing.

Being the 4th of July, we expected warm weather and were somewhat surprised at how cold it is in San Fran. The weather reports said the temperature would be around 20 but with the wind/fog it was more like 10.
reviews.title: Great property and great location

reviews.text: My wife and I went to San Francisco & Napa for our 10th anniversary. We stayed at the Palomar at the back end of our trip - and it was well worth it.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.text: The staff made us feel special and took really good care of us. We only stayed two nights, but their hospitality made us feel like we were long-time friends and frequent guests.
reviews.title: Swanky hotel at a great price

reviews.text: The bell staff was very efficient and they brought up our bags right away. When we were getting ready to leave for the airport, they helped us box up and seal a case of wine we were checking as luggage on our flight.
reviews.title: Here's the good and bad about the Palomar...
This hotel has ROTTEN service, stay at your own risk.
reviews.text: For our anniversary they gave us a nice bottle of red and box of chocolates. They also obtained great dinner reservations for us.
Our room was really nice and spacious. Turn down service was a nice touch - they left more chocolates. My wife loved the bath accessories, hair-dryer, etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed at many hotels in SF in the same area but never the Palomar. My colleague and I ended up there by accident (the hotel we booked was not really open when we arrived- long story) and they sent us to the Palomar. We were both very impressed. Everything was excellent. They treated us really well when we arrived - including upgrading our rooms. The staff was fantastic - helpful, knowledgeable with great personalities. They really went out of the way to make us happy and welcome - including ordering a complimentary champagne to a restaurant we ate at. We did eat dinner and breakfast there and it was very good. The rooms were comfortable, the complimentary coffee, tea etc in the morning - with the NYT and WSF - was appreciated. Its a hotel with a personality and I'll definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A new favorite

reviews.text: When you book at a boutique hotel you always expect the finishing touches but the staff at The Palomar are truly amazing.
reviews.title: Amazing Staff, Fantastic Experience

reviews.text: They go above and beyond to ensure that your stay exceeds all your expectations.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is pretty good, but a little bit dated now. I stayed on the 9th floor in a room overlooking Market Street. Every day there are drummers busking on the street below which can be a bit annoying as it’s impossible to get away from the noise (probably better to get a room overlooking 4th St if you can). There was a good desk to work on with a comfortable chair provided, so good for business in that sense. Beware thought that the business ‘centre’ amounts to one PC and one printer wedged into a tiny alcove outside the lift on the 5th floor. There was no way to open the windows in my room which I don’t like and the ventilation system was pretty antiquated. Still, temperature control didn’t seem to be much of a problem when I was there in February. I was in San Francisco a few months before and stayed at the Hilton which, although I usually prefer to avoid big chains, was on balance better than the Palomar.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.text: Conveniently located in downtown San Francisco. Two minute walk to the Westfield mall, Powell BART/MUNI stop, and excellent restaurants. Extremely quiet with double-paned windows. Gym, restaurant, complimentary wine hour, complimentary coffee, superbly decorated, comfortable bed, and excellent customer service. I can't think of anything that would have made my stay better.
reviews.title: An excellent stay, great location
Jem of a find
reviews.text: Lovely location, quiet setting. Overall very lovely experience.
Liked:
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: clean room
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Hotel Palomar
Hotel review
reviews.text: modern decor with awesome ammenities
great TV
reviews.title: Great Stay @ Palomar

reviews.text: I booked my stay at the Hotel Palomar through a great deal my travel agent got for me. The property has a great location right in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Check-in was handled flawlessly and my room was comfortable and spotlessly clean, if a bit small. Considering that I was not planning on spending a great deal of time in my room, this wasn't an issue.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor is modern and tasteful and the staff was never too busy to handle any request. All of the four-star touches one would expect were present and service was impeccable. In addition the Palomar has free wireless internet.
reviews.title: I would stay here again! Truly pleasant!

reviews.text: Things that might be issues for some travelers would be room size (small - would have been even smaller with a second person in the room) and view (mine was of the Old Navy skylight). That being said, these weren't big issues for me as I wasn't spending a lot of time in my room, and the positives far outweighed the negatives.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.text: I went to San Francisco for the weekend. I wanted to be in close proximity to the Warfield concert venue on Market. I did my homework and researched all the hotels within close proximity of the venue. So I chose the Palomar, because I wanted to stay at a boutique hotel, it was walking distance to the venue and the pictures and reviews were great. I have stayed at a Kimpton hotel, but not in many years.
reviews.title: very nice location

likes.liked: — Comfy beds, attentive staff, great location
likes.disliked: — cd player didn't work, no view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I pulled up to the valet, the doorman immediately assisted us by radio-ing the valet attendant to check in our vehicle. He also introduced himself, extremely polite and friendly gentleman. He helped us with our bags and showed us where to check in.
reviews.title: Not 5 star and overpriced
Thoroughly pleased, fantastic location
reviews.text: I booked a one night stop-over stay in the Hotel Palomar based on the positive reviews on this website and I certainly didn't disagree.

We were greeted after a long journey in a friendly and professional manner by all members of staff. The room, although interior facing was nicely decorated and extremely quiet. The bed was the most comfortable bed I'd ever slept in a hotel which meant we had a wonderful nights sleep.
reviews.title: First class all the way

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is brilliant if you want to be close to Union Square. It is just two blocks away and all flat walking, so no steep hills to climb!
reviews.title: Great room, not-so-great service

reviews.text: The only negative was the pricey restaurant in the hotel. We ate there being jet lagged and needing an early night but $23 for a couple of scallops, although very nice, was a little over the top!
reviews.title: central location
Highly Recommended
reviews.text: My wife and I loved our 4 night stay at the Hotel Palomar. They honored my request for an exterior facing room, higher floor. Limited views of Market Street and nearby tall buildings/Marriott. Very spacious room, great layout and calming interior design with in room CD and all the tech equipment you could want. Phenomenal service, great location between Soma and Union Square shopping, a stone's throw from the Moscone Convention Center, half a short block from the Bart Station. We ate at the hotel's posh five star restaurant, "The Fifth Floor", which was a splurge but worth every penny for a memorable evening of out of this world cuisine, romantic atmosphere and doting service (the much more affordable breakfast was also very good, with quick and convenient service). A great home base in a world class city.

We stayed at the Palomar for quite a while, 9 nights while attending a conference in the city. Access to the hotel via the BART system from the bay airports is easy as there's a stop across the street. Check-in was fast and pleasant, the lobby small, but well turned out.
reviews.title: A nice property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was was nicely appointed. Though, while artfully done, the finishes, textiles and carpet all looked a little tired and in need of a touch up. One annoyance was the lack of a proper dresser or bureau the only piece of storage furniture being the TV armoire which also housed the mini bar, books, etc. The bathroom was just "ok".
reviews.title: Over Priced, Lacking Customer Service

reviews.text: A couple annoyances, while access to public transport is nice, there is a prominent stop right in front of the hotel so quite often during the day the sidewalk is packed with people waiting for the bus, also the housekeeping service started out ok, but slowly became more inconsistent as the week unfolded.
reviews.title: Got to sleep on the floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff were very helpful, attentive and able to answer most questions I had about the city, etc.
reviews.title: Great Location & friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Palomar in early September. This was our first hotel in San Francisco (we stayed four nights and split it up into two hotels so we could sample two different locations). This is a very beautiful hotel. Very stylish. Great interior (especially the "restaurant" floor). Loved the floors in the lobby. The staff is very friendly. The location is great, especially if you want to go to the Museum of Modern Art, which is just a few blocks away. Very easy to walk to Union Square and lots of other places. Easy to catch public transportation also.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel

reviews.text: Love staying at Kimpton properties. I spent a week at the Palomar SF on a work-related trip. Service was excellent as always, was upgraded to a larger room, and the hotel is a short walk, Muni or Bart to anything.
reviews.title: Great hotel, terrific service and perfect location

reviews.text: The gym is average, but you can get discounted passes to Club One Fitness a few blocks away. Room service was high quality, although the menu was limited (I was surprised they stopped service breakfast options so early).
reviews.title: Great hotel, awesome service. Matt was the best!

reviews.text: I didn't bring my dog this time, but it's as pet-friendly as you can get.
reviews.title: made us feel like celebrities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super cute, boutique hotel conveniently located next to the Westfield Mall in downtown SF. The rooms are nice, the service is excellent, and Matt, the front doorman, was especially awesome and provided excellent guest service throughout the entire stay. He surely makes you feel super welcome and at home! I will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: hotel staff is impeccable. location is everything and they got it!! shopping dining bars. fun fun. stay here every time. they have a wine hour must go Obvi. you can bring pets or they will provide you with a fish the complimentary robes!! love!
reviews.title: Very very poor
Pleasant, business-oriented hotel
reviews.text: Booked this one through Amex for a conference. Completely pleasant, but nothing out of the ordinary. I didn't have much time for shopping, but can see it has a totally awesome location for the big shopping chains (Saks, etc..). The one very good thing was it's close proximity to the tram that takes you out to Ocean Beach, which was absolutely beautiful. The staff was lovely and helpful; forgive me, I loved that it was next door to a large Container store, which being from Canada I'd never seen. Smallish room, not unlike Manhattan hotels.

I wasn't quite sure what to expect from this hotel, as I had never even heard of it before. My friend booked this hotel for us on a recent stay, and I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. From the moment we walked into the chic, hip lobby, I was struck by how kind and courteous the desk staff was. The atmosphere is upscale and hip, it would appeal to anyone who demands the best in service and style, for the business or pleasure travelers alike.
reviews.title: Great City Hotel Experience!

likes.liked: — The spacious room and cool looking decor.
likes.disliked: — The area is not the greatest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean and spacious, with fabulous leopard patterned carpet and some wonderful Aveda toiletries waiting for us in the attractively decorated bathroom. Everything was in good working order in the room, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bellhop brought up our things very quickly and our every request was met in a timely and courteous manner.
reviews.title: not really a 4 star

reviews.text: My favorite part of this hotel was the amazing mini dinner that we had in the Fifth Floor Restaurant. The restaurant was full with holiday party goers and other guests, and we didn't have a reservation. However, the hostess accomodated us with no questions asked and we were seated as soon as we got into the crowded room. I had the chicory salad and sour dough encrusted mackeral, both of which were outstanding, well-prepared, tasty, and beautifully presented. The service in the restaurant was as impeccable as it was at the front desk/room attendants, courteous, prompt and professional. This is some of the best food I have ever had the pleasure of eating in a hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Average stay at central hotel

description: Named one of the world's top 500 hotels by Travel + Leisure, the centrally located Hotel Palomar San Francisco offers a sophisticated urban sanctuary. This luxury boutique hotel occupies a beautiful historic building five floors above the bustling city streets. Showcasing the acclaimed Fifth Floor restaurant, the hotel is within easy walking distance of Union Square, Moscone Center, the Financial District, the thriving SOMA district and the best of San Francisco's theaters, shops and galleries.
